HamCalc 2.1 documentation

baromtr – Barometer Reading Equivalents¶

Analysis¶

Atmophere pressure can be measured in a variety of units.

This program provides conversions from Standard Atmospheres (atm) to a variety of other units. Specifically:

  • Standard atmospheres, atm
  • Millibars, mb, 1033*atm
  • Centimetres of mercury, cm.Hg, 76*atm
  • Inches of mercury, in.Hg, 29.921*atm
  • Metres of water, m.w, 10.3322*atm
  • Inches of water, in.w, 406.782*atm
  • Feet of water, ft.w, 33.899*atm
  • Pounds per square inch, lb/in², 14.696*atm
  • Pounds per square foot, lb/ft², 2116.2*atm
  • Kilograms per square centimetre, kg/cm², 1.033*atm
  • Kilopascals, kPa, 101.325*atm

It also provides a table with kPa, in.Hg, lb/in², millibars and atm.

Implementation¶

hamcalc.math.baromtr – Barometer Reading Equivalents

This is, essentially, a collection of unit conversions for various ways to measure atmospheric presssure.

The units include:

  • MB Millibars
  • ATM Standard Atmospheres, sometimes abbreviated S.A.
  • CM_Hg cm of Mercury
  • IN_Hg inches of Mercury
  • M_W meters of Water
  • IN_W inches of Water
  • FT_W feet of Water
  • PSI pounds per square inch, lb/in²
  • PSF pounds per square foot, lb/ft²
  • BAR kilograms per square cm, kg/cm²
  • KPA kilo Pascals

These units are wrapped in two functions to provide features for the application.

Ths includes is a Table of values, and all unit Equivalents for a given value.

Here are some test cases.

>>> import hamcalc.math.baromtr as baromtr
>>> t= list(baromtr.table())
>>> t[0]
(95.5, 28.200893165556376, 13.85115223291389, 973.6146064643474, 0.9425117197137922)
>>> t[-1]
(106.0, 31.301514927214406, 15.374053787318035, 1080.6612385886997, 1.0461386627189735)
>>> len(t)
22
>>> baromtr.equivalent( 1033, baromtr.MB )
(1033.0, 1.0, 76.0, 29.921, 10.3322, 406.782, 33.899, 14.696, 2116.2, 1.033, 101.325)

hamcalc.math.baromtr.equivalent(value, unit)[source]¶

Converts a value in the given units to a series of other units.

Parameters:
  • value – Measurement
  • unit – Source unit class.
Returns:

Tuple with pressure in mb, atm, cm_hg, in_hg, m_w, in_w, ft_w, psi, psf, bar, kpa.
hamcalc.math.baromtr.intro()[source]¶

Returns the text from the introductory page.

hamcalc.math.baromtr.table(kpa_start=95.5, kpa_stop=106.5, kpa_step=0.5)[source]¶

Yields a sequence of values from 95.5 kPa to 106 kPa in .5 kPa steps.

Returns:tuple of kPa, in.hg, lb/in², mb, atm

Legacy Notes¶

None, interestingly.
